info.description:
Direktiv Open API Specification
Direktiv Documentation can be found at https://docs.direktiv.io/
info.title: Direktiv API

get.description: Gets a list of namespace knative services.

post.description:
Creates namespace scoped knative service.
Service Names are unique on a scope level.
These services can be used as functions in workflows, more about this can be read here:
https://docs.direktiv.io/docs/walkthrough/using-functions.html

parameters.description: Payload that contains information on new service
parameters.name: Service

image.description: Target image a service will use

minScale.description: Minimum amount of service pods to be live

size.description: Size of created service pods, 0 = small, 1 = medium, 2 = large

get.description: Get details of a namespace scoped knative service.

post.description: Creates a new namespace scoped knative service revision.

parameters.description: Payload that contains information on service revision
parameters.name: Service

image.description: Target image a service will use

minScale.description: Minimum amount of service pods to be live

delete.description: Deletes namespace scoped knative service and all its revisions.

get.description:
Watch the revision list of a namespace scoped knative service.
Note: This is a Server-Sent-Event endpoint, and will not work with the default swagger client.

Watch a namespace scoped knative service revision.
The target revision generation is the number suffix on a revision.
Example: A revision named 'namespace-direktiv-fast-request-00003' would have the revisionGeneration '00003'.
Note: This is a Server-Sent-Event endpoint, and will not work with the default swagger client.

delete.description:
Delete a namespace scoped knative service revision.
The target revision generation is the number suffix on a revision.
Example: A revision named 'namespace-direktiv-fast-request-00003' would have the revisionGeneration '00003'.

get.description:
List a revisions pods of a namespace scoped knative service.
The target revision generation is the number suffix on a revision.
Example: A revision named 'namespace-direktiv-fast-request-00003' would have the revisionGeneration '00003'.
get.summary: Get Namespace Service Revision Pods List

200.description: successfully got list of a service revision pods

get.description:
Get a workflow scoped knative service details.
Note: This is a Server-Sent-Event endpoint, and will not work with the default swagger client.

Get a workflow scoped knative service revision.
This will return details on a single revision.
The target revision generation (rev query) is the number suffix on a revision.
Example: A revision named 'workflow-10640097968065193909-get-00001' would have the revisionGeneration '00001'.
Get the revision list of a workflow scoped knative service.

List a revisions pods of a workflow scoped knative service.
The target revision generation (rev query) is the number suffix on a revision.
Example: A revision named 'workflow-10640097968065193909-get-00001' would have the revisionGeneration '00001'.
get.summary: Get Workflow Service Revision Pods List

200.description: successfully got list of a service revision pods

get.description: Gets a list of workflow knative services.
Gets the list of namespace registries.

post.description:
Create a namespace container registry.
This can be used to connect your workflows to private container registries that require tokens.
The data property in the body is made up from the registry user and token. It follows the pattern :
data=USER:TOKEN

data.description: Target registry connection data containing the user and token.

post.description: Test a registry with provided url, username and token
post.summary: Test a registry to make sure the connection is okay

password.description: token to authenticate with the registry

url.description: The url to test if the registry is valid

username.description: username to authenticate with the registry

post.description: JQ Playground is a sandbox where you can test jq queries with custom data.
post.summary: JQ Playground api to test jq queries

parameters.description: Payload that contains both the JSON data to manipulate and jq query.
parameters.name: JQ payload

query.description: jq query to manipulate JSON data

get.description: Gets Direktiv Server Logs.
Watches logs of the pods for a service. This can be a namespace service or a workflow service.
Gets the list of namespaces.

delete.description:
Delete a namespace.
A namespace will not delete by default if it has any child resources (workflows, etc...).
Deleting the namespace with all its children can be done using the `recursive` query parameter.

post.description:
Broadcast a cloud event to a namespace.
Cloud events posted to this api will be picked up by any workflows listening to the same event type on the namescape.
The body of this request should follow the cloud event core specification defined at https://github.com/cloudevents/spec .

parameters.description: Cloud Event request to be sent.
parameters.name: cloudevent

get.description: Gets a namespace config.

parameters.description: Payload that contains the config information to set. Note: This payload only need to contain the properities you wish to set.
parameters.name: Config Payload

broadcast.description: Configuration on which direktiv operations will trigger coud events on the namespace

200.description: namespace config has been successfully been updated

get.description: Get current event listeners.
Get recent events history.

post.description: Replay a cloud event to a namespace.

get.description: Gets a list of instances in a namespace.
Gets the details of a executed workflow instance in this namespace.
Gets the input an instance was provided when executed.
Gets the logs of an executed instance.
Gets the metadata of an instance.
Gets the output an instance was provided when executed.
Gets a list of variables in a instance.
Get the value sorted in a instance variable.

put.description:
Set the value sorted in a instance variable.
If the target variable does not exists, it will be created.
Variable data can be anything.

get.description: Gets Namespace Level Logs.
Get metrics of failed workflows in the targeted namespace.
get.summary: Gets Namespace Failed Workflow Instances Metrics

get.description: Get metrics of invoked workflows in the targeted namespace.
Get timing metrics of workflows in the targeted namespace.
Get metrics of successful workflows in the targeted namespace.
get.summary: Gets Namespace Successful Workflow Instances Metrics

get.description: Gets the list of namespace secrets. Also can use for search by setting query param op=search and term=<searchingName>
get.summary: Get List of Namespace Secrets or Search for Namespace Secrets by given name

get.description: Gets the list of namespace secrets and folders inside specific folder.
get.summary: Get List of Namespace nodes inside Folder

200.description: successfully got namespace nodes inside sepcific folder
namespace folder has been successfully created
namespace folder has been successfully deleted
namespace secret has been successfully created
namespace secret has been successfully deleted

put.description: Creates a directory at the target path.

get.description: Gets Workflow and Directory Nodes at nodePath.

delete.description: Creates a directory at the target path.

parameters.description: whether to recursively delete child nodes
parameters.name: recursive

put.description:
Creates a workflow at the target path.
The body of this request should contain the workflow yaml.

parameters.description: Payload that contains the direktiv workflow yaml to create.
parameters.name: workflow data

schema.example:
description: A simple no-op state that returns Hello world!
states:
- id: helloworld
  type: noop
  transform:
    result: Hello world!

post.description: Executes a workflow with optionally some input provided in the request body as json.

parameters.description: The input of this workflow instance
parameters.name: Workflow Input

get.description: Get workflow level logs.

Get the timing metrics of a workflow's instance.
This returns a total sum of the milliseconds a workflow has been executed for.
Get metrics of invoked workflow instances.

Get Sankey metrics of a workflow revision.
If ref query is not provided, metrics for the latest revision
will be retrieved.
get.summary: Get Sankey metrics of a workflow revision.

get.description:
Get the state timing metrics of a workflow's instance.
This returns the timing of individual states in a workflow.
get.summary: Gets a Workflow State Time Metrics

get.description: Get metrics of a workflow, where the instance was successful.

put.description:
Set the value sorted in a workflow variable.
If the target variable does not exists, it will be created.
Variable data can be anything.

post.description:
Set Cloud Event for Workflow to Log to.
When configured type `direktiv.instanceLog` cloud events will be generated with the `logger` parameter set to the configured value.
Workflows can be configured to generate cloud events on their namespace anything the log parameter produces data.
Please find more information on this topic here:
https://docs.direktiv.io/docs/examples/logging.html
post.summary: Set Cloud Event for Workflow to Log to

post.description:
Toggle's whether or not a workflow is active.
Disabled workflows cannot be invoked. This includes start event and scheduled workflows.
post.summary: Set Cloud Event for Workflow to Log to

parameters.description: Whether or not the workflow is alive or disabled
parameters.name: Workflow Live Status

post.description:
Updates a workflow at the target path.
The body of this request should contain the workflow yaml you want to update to.

parameters.description: Payload that contains the updated direktiv workflow yaml.
parameters.name: workflow data

schema.example:
description: A simple no-op state that returns Hello world Updated !!!
states:
- id: helloworld
  type: noop
  transform:
    result: Hello world Updated !!!

get.description: Get the value sorted in a workflow variable.
Gets a list of variables in a workflow.

Executes a workflow. This path will wait until the workflow execution has completed and return the instance output.
NOTE: Input can also be provided with the `input.X` query parameters; Where `X` is the json key.
Only top level json keys are supported when providing input with query parameters.

parameters.description: Manually set the Content-Type response header instead of auto-detected. This doesn't change the body of the response in any way.
parameters.name: ctype

parameters.description: If provided, instead of returning the entire output json the response body will contain the single top-level json field
parameters.name: field

parameters.description: If set to true, will return an empty output as null, encoded base64 data as decoded binary data, and quoted json strings as a escaped string.
parameters.name: raw-output

post.description:
Executes a workflow with optionally some input provided in the request body as json.
This path will wait until the workflow execution has completed and return the instance output.
NOTE: Input can also be provided with the `input.X` query parameters; Where `X` is the json key.
Only top level json keys are supported when providing input with query parameters.
Input query parameters are only read if the request has no body.
post.summary: Await Execute a Workflow With Body

parameters.description: Manually set the Content-Type response header instead of auto-detected. This doesn't change the body of the response in any way.
parameters.name: ctype

parameters.description: If provided, instead of returning the entire output json the response body will contain the single top-level json field
parameters.name: field

parameters.description: If set to true, will return an empty output as null, encoded base64 data as decoded binary data, and quoted json strings as a escaped string.
parameters.name: raw-output

parameters.description: The input of this workflow instance
parameters.name: Workflow Input

get.description: Gets a list of variables in a namespace.
Get the value sorted in a namespace variable.

put.description:
Set the value sorted in a namespace variable.
If the target variable does not exists, it will be created.
Variable data can be anything.

get.description: Returns version information for servers in the cluster.
get.summary: Returns version information for servers in the cluster.

OkBody.description: OkBody is an arbitrary placeholder response that represents an ok response body
